english: structural particle; to get, obtain; must, have to

etymology.description: 貝 (cowry) + 又 (hand) = hand obtaining a cowry -> obtain
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted a hand picking up a valuable cowry shell, symbolizing acquiring or obtaining things. The addition of 彳 (road) suggests finding this valuable on a path. Over time, graphical changes in scripts altered the components visually but retained the concept of obtaining.
etymology.simplification: None, as traditional form is used.

examples.english: I have to go to work.

examples.chinese: 他得到了一份礼物(禮物)。
努力工作后，他得到了认可(認可)。
examples.pinyin: Nǔlì gōngzuò hòu, tā dédàole rènkě.
examples.english: After working hard, he received recognition.
